title: Home and Descriptors
goal: Use `zdani`, `sutra`, and `barda` to describe places and qualities.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Names in bridi — translate to Lojban:

1. Alice goes to London.      → ?
2. Bob loves Mary.            → ?
3. I talk to Tom.             → ?

(Answers: la .alis. cu klama la .lyndyn., la .bob. cu prami la .meris., mi tavla la .tam.)

Say each aloud.

New Material (5-7 min)

Three New Descriptors

ti barda — This is big.

Today you'll learn three versatile gismu:

Lojban Place Structure English
zdani x1 is a home of x2 home, house
sutra x1 is fast at x2 fast, quick
barda x1 is big in dimension x2 big, large

zdani — Home

zdani means "x1 is a home/nest/dwelling of x2":

Lojban Gloss English
ti zdani this home This is a home.
ti zdani mi this home-of me This is my home.
la .alis. cu klama la zdani Alice [cu] go-to [the] home Alice goes home.

Wait — la zdani? Yes! You can use la with any word to mean "the thing called [word]." Here it means "the place called 'home'" — i.e., home.

sutra — Fast

sutra describes speed:

Lojban Gloss English
do sutra you fast You are fast.
la .bob. cu sutra Bob [cu] fast Bob is fast.
la .bob. cu cadzu sutra Bob [cu] walk fast Bob walks fast.

In the last example, sutra modifies cadzu. When two gismu appear together like this, the second modifies the first — creating a tanru (compound). You'll study tanru more later; for now, just notice the pattern.

barda — Big

barda describes size:

Lojban Gloss English
ti barda this big This is big.
la .paris. cu barda Paris [cu] big Paris is big.
zdani cu barda home [cu] big The home is big.

Combining Descriptors

You can chain sentences to give multiple descriptions:

Lojban English
ti zdani mi .i ti barda This is my home. It is big.
la .bob. cu sutra .i la .bob. cu xamgu Bob is fast. Bob is good.
la .paris. cu barda .i la .paris. cu melbi Paris is big. Paris is beautiful.

Key Point

zdani (home), sutra (fast), and barda (big) describe qualities. Combine them with names and other gismu to build richer descriptions.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Translation (Lojban → English)

  1. ti zdani mi
  2. la .bob. cu sutra
  3. la .lyndyn. cu barda
  4. mi klama la zdani
  5. ninmu cu cadzu sutra
Answers
  1. This is my home.
  2. Bob is fast.
  3. London is big.
  4. I go home.
  5. A woman walks fast.

Exercise 2: Translation (English → Lojban)

  1. This is big.
  2. Alice is fast.
  3. The home is good.
  4. I go home. (use la zdani)
  5. Paris is big. Paris is beautiful.
Answers
  1. ti barda
  2. la .alis. cu sutra
  3. zdani cu xamgu
  4. mi klama la zdani
  5. la .paris. cu barda .i la .paris. cu melbi

Exercise 3: Describe Your Home

Build 3 sentences about your home or city:

Example:

ti zdani mi
.i ti barda
.i ti melbi

(This is my home. It is big. It is beautiful.)

Write and say your own description.

items.text: Paris is big. Paris is beautiful.

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I go home." → mi klama la zdani
  2. "You are fast." → do sutra
  3. "London is big. Tokyo is beautiful." → la .lyndyn. cu barda .i la .tokios. cu melbi
  4. "This is my home. It is good." → ti zdani mi .i ti xamgu

Today's Vocab

Lojban Place Structure English
zdani x1 is a home/nest of x2 home
sutra x1 is fast at x2 fast
barda x1 is big in dimension x2 big

Week 2 gismu so far: cmene, prenu, nanmu, ninmu, verba, zdani, sutra, barda (8/8 — complete!)

items.place: x1 is a home/nest of x2
x1 is big in dimension x2

sections.content:
Summary

You learned zdani (home), sutra (fast), and barda (big). You can now describe places and qualities, go home (klama la zdani), and combine descriptors with named people and places. All 8 gismu for Week 2 are now introduced.

Tomorrow preview: You'll learn ki'e (thanks) and je'e (acknowledged), completing the vocative set for basic social interaction.
